atra kutas nā ucyate āsvāda ādīnava nissaraṇa ādīnām jñānāni
sarvāṇi imāni atra parigṛhītāni

original: kintu saṅgītikāraḥ saṃkṣipan na vistaraśa uvāca //
analyzed: kintu saṅgīti kāraḥ saṃkṣipan na vistaraśaḥ uvāca
catuścatvāriṃśat jñāna vargaḥ eka uttara dviśatatamaḥ
saptasaptati jñāna vargaḥ

original: sūtra uktam- saptasaptatijñānāni yaduta jātipratyayaṃ jarāmaraṇamiti jñānam /
analyzed: sūtre uktam saptasaptati jñānāni yat uta jāti pratyayam jarā maraṇam iti jñānam
asatyām jātau na asti jarā maraṇam iti jñānam
evam atīte na āgate dhvani api
yat asya dharma sthiti jñānam

original: tadapi anityaṃ saṃskṛtaṃ kṛtakaṃ pratītyasamutpannaṃ kṣayadharma, vipariṇāmadharma, viyogadharma, vyayadharma iti jñānam /
analyzed: tat api anityam saṃskṛtam kṛtakam pratītyasamutpannam kṣaya dharma vipariṇāma dharma viyoga dharma vyaya dharmaḥ iti jñānam
yāvat avidyā pratyayāḥ saṃskārāḥ iti api evam iti

original: tatra kasmānnoktaṃ- jarāmaraṇasya svabhāvo nirodho mārga ityādi /
analyzed: tatra kasmāt na uktam jarā maraṇasya svabhāvaḥ nirodhaḥ mārgaḥ ityādi
hita jñasya kṛte evam uktam tasya dvāra tva mātram aviṣkaroti
anyat api evam jñeyam

original: tīrthikā bahavo nidāne bhrāntā vadanti- laukikānāṃ padārthānāṃ heturlokātmaka ityādi /
analyzed: tīrthikāḥ bahavaḥ nidāne bhrāntāḥ vadanti laukikānām padārthānām hetuḥ loka ātmakaḥ ityādi
atas bhagavān teṣām nidāna mātram āha
jāti pratyayam jarā maraṇam iti uktvā kasmāt punar āha asatyām jātau iti
niyama artham
yathā dānam puṇyasya hetuḥ
śīlena api puṇyam vindate
yathā uktam dhṛta śīlaḥ deveṣu utpadyate iti
kecid manyante jarā maraṇa pratyayā jātiḥ iti
kecid ahetukā jātiḥ iti
atas niyamaḥ ucyate
kasmāt atīte na agate dhvani punar niyamaḥ ucyate

original: pratyutpannamatītādhvanaḥ kadācidbhinnadharma bhavati yadutātītānāṃ sattvānāmāyurapramāṇaṃ prabhāvaśca devatulya ityevamādi /
analyzed: pratyutpannam atītādhvanaḥ kadācid bhinna dharma bhavati yat uta atītānām sattvānām āyuḥ apramāṇam prabhāvaḥ ca deva tulyaḥ iti evamādi

original: āyurādi bhinnaṃ jarāmaraṇapratyayo 'pi bhinno bhavediti janā vadeyuriti bhītyā niyama ucyate /
analyzed: āyuḥ ādi bhinnam jarā maraṇa pratyayaḥ bhinnaḥ bhavet iti janāḥ vadeyuḥ iti bhītyā niyamaḥ ucyate
anāgate pi evam vaktavyam
idam ṣaḍvidham dharma sthiti jñānam
anyat nāma nirvāṇa jñānam
jarā maraṇa santāna kara tvāt ucyate anityam saṃskṛtam kṛtakam pratītyasamutpannam
kṣaya dharma vipariṇāma dharmaḥ iti anitya ākāraḥ
viyoga dharmaḥ iti duḥkha ākāraḥ
vyaya dharmaḥ iti anātma śūnya ākāraḥ

original: kasmāt tatra rūpasya svarūpaṃ nirodhaḥ vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇāṃ vijñānasya ca svarūpaṃ nirodhaḥ /
analyzed: kasmāt tatra rūpasya sva rūpam nirodhaḥ vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām vijñānasya ca sva rūpam nirodhaḥ
ayam trividha vipaśyanānām arthaḥ iti ākhyāyate

original: yathoktaṃ sūtre- yo bhikṣavaḥ saptabhiḥ sthānopāyaiḥ tribhirvipaśyanārthaiśca samanvitaḥ sa kṣipramāsravāṇāṃ kṣayamanuprāpnoti /
analyzed: yathā uktam sūtre yaḥ bhikṣavaḥ saptabhiḥ sthānopāyaiḥ tribhiḥ vipaśyanā arthaiḥ ca samanvitaḥ sa kṣipram āsravāṇām kṣayam anuprāpnoti
idam eva nirvāṇa jñānam bhavati iti

original: ityādi nidānajñānāni apramāṇaśatasahasrāṇi santi yaduta  cakṣurvijñānamityādi /
analyzed: ityādi nidāna jñānāni apramāṇa śata sahasrāṇi santi yat uta cakṣuḥ vijñānam ityādi
yathoktam sūtre cakṣuṣa karma pratyayaḥ
karmaṇaḥ tṛṣṇā pratyayaḥ
tṛṣṇāyāḥ avidyā pratyayaḥ
avidyāyāḥ a yoni śomanaskāraḥ pratyayaḥ
a yoniśaḥ manaskārasya cakṣuḥ rūpam pratyayaḥ
āsravāṇām ayoniśas mananam pratyayaḥ
āhārāṇām tṛṣṇā pratyayaḥ
pañca kāmaguṇānām kabalīkāra āhāra ādayaḥ pratyayāḥ
narakasya alpa āyuṣaḥ ca prāṇa atipāta ādayaḥ pratyayāḥ

original: yadidānīntanaṃ duḥkhaṃ pūrvatanīnañca duḥkhaṃ, sarvasyābhūtasaṃjñā pratyayaḥ /
analyzed: yat idānīntanam duḥkham duḥkham sarvasya abhūta saṃjñā pratyayaḥ
abhūta saṃjñāyāḥ kāya cittayoḥ priya apriye pratyayaḥ
priya apriyayoḥ kāma rāgaḥ pratyayaḥ

original: kāmarāgasya mithyāvitarkaḥ pratyayaḥ ityevamādipratyayānāṃ jñānamapramāṇamanavadhi svayamevonnetavyam //
analyzed: kāma rāgasya mithyā vitarkaḥ pratyayaḥ iti evamādi pratyayānām jñānam apramāṇam anavadhi svayam eva unnetavyam
